NAME: Name
FIND_ARTICLE: Find the content you are looking for
RAISON_DETRE: A subsidiary of the APRIL group and an independent wholesale broker (MGA), APRIL Canada provides niche commercial and personal insurance across Canada that meet the needs of our partners when it matters most.  Discover our goal to be the MGA of choice, by offering our broker partners and insureds the best of technology, underwriting expertise and service excellence to provide a remarkable customer experience.
NEWS_BRIEF: Our expertise in our markets and our knowledge of our brokers' and partners' expectations allow us to offer attractive and innovative solutions by positioning ourselves as a major player in the industry. Discover our tips and news!
CAREER_BRIEF_TITLE: Together, we take care of the future
CAREER_BRIEF: At APRIL, you get to take care of yourself and others too, push boundaries and work effectively by combining the best of what digital technology and human relations have to offer.
COMMUNICATE_WITH_US: Do not hesitate to contact us via the following form.
SUSCRIBE_CHECKBOX: I would like to subscribe to the newsletter.
NEWSLETTER_SUBSCRIPTION_DETAILS: Thank you, you will start to receive our newsletter shortly.
REQUIRED_FIELDS: Please fill in all the fields
REQUIRED_FIELDS_OPTIONAL: Please fill in all the required fields
INVALID_PHONE: Please enter a valid phone number
CONTACT_FORM_DETAILS: Thank you, we are treating your request and you will receive an answer shortly.
ABOUT_ONE: Founded in 1988, APRIL is an international group offering innovative insurance solutions. APRIL’s 2,300 staff members aim to offer their customers and partners an outstanding experience combining the best of humans and technology.
ABOUT_TWO: By 2023, APRIL aims to become a digital, omni-channel and agile operator, a champion of customer experience and the leader in its markets.
ABOUT_THREE: APRIL Canada is an independent wholesale broker (MGA) that develops and offers a wide range of niche personal and commercial online solutions.
OPERATION_COUNTRY: Countries where the group has operations
YOUR_CONTACTS_DETAILS: For any questions, don’t hesitate to contact one of our business developer manager.
OFFER_BEST_EXPERIENCE: Take care of the future with APRIL, come and join us!
BEST_EXPERIENCE_DETAILS: Taking care of the future means being committed and responsible with regard to our employees, customers and partners, as well as making a real and positive contribution to society.
BEST_EXPERIENCE_DETAILS_2: Taking care of the future means nurturing our talents in the four corners of the world, and earning the trust of the individuals, professionals and companies we work with on a daily basis.
BEST_EXPERIENCE_DETAILS_3: Taking care of the future also means combining the best of what people and technology have to offer in order to provide an outstanding insurance experience for all.
APRIL_LIFE: At APRIL, corporate culture is important:
VALUE_TWO: Team spirit is very important. We help and respect each other. When one of us wins, we all win.
VALUE_FOUR: We question ways of doing things to go further.
VALUE_FIVE: We have an open-door policy: managers are always listening and cooperation between teams is encouraged.
WHY_DETAILS: Recognized as one of the top employers in the insurance industry by Top Insurance Employer 2021, we offer our employees a wide range of benefits:
WHY_THREE: New, coloured and open office space;
WHY_FIVE: Competitive benefits program, including group insurance, employee assistance program and telemedicine for employees and their families;
WHY_SIX: Incentives (profit-sharing program) for all employees starting in the first year of employment;
WHY_SEVEN: Offer of continuing education, the possibility of training paid by the employer;
WHY_HEIGHT: Flexible hours and teleworking possible: work/family balance at the heart of the business model;
SEND_RESUME: Can't find the job you're looking for?
SEND_RESUME_DETAILS: APRIL Canada is constantly looking for new talent. Send us your CV using the form below.
OFFERS_DETAILS: Find your dream job by searching by city and domain. Click on the offer to see the job description. There’s no opening for the job you’re after? Feel free to send us your CV using the form at the bottom of the page.
SERVICE_DETAILS: At APRIL, we believe that simplifying insurance is about delivering a great customer experience and supporting our brokers and partners every day. We work together to create a lasting partnership for our mutual benefit.
INNOVATION_AT_HEART: Innovation at the heart of our what we do
INNOVATION_AT_HEART_DETAILS: With a promise to make insurance easier and more accessible, we place innovation at the heart of our strategy to build the solutions of tomorrow. With APRIL ON, our broker portal, we support you in your digital transformation: get a quote and request to bind in just a few clicks.
SNAP: APRIL, the first MGA to offer credit card payment
SNAP_DETAILS: APRIL has partnered with SNAP, North America's leading provider of innovative payment solutions, to offer new, simple and flexible billing options for your clients. With a streamlined online process, offer flexible payment term options by credit card or directly from a bank account. Discover a unique direct-to-insureds billing solution on your APRIL quotes, including those completed online in APRIL ON!
COMMUNICATION_METHODS: Do not hesitate to contact us by one of the following means.
OR_BDM: Or with our Business Development Managers
BDM_FOR_WEST: manager for Ontario and Western Canada
OFFLINE_FORMS_DETAILS: You will find a list of all the downloadable proposal forms. Nothing is easier to send them to us. Download and complete the document for which you would like a quote. Send it to us using the document submission form.
BECOME_BROKER_PARTNER_DETAILS: Benefit from many advantages by becoming an APRIL partner: specialized underwriting teams dedicated to their line of business to serve you better, a wide range of solutions for your risks, an online quotation tool to get an indicative premium in a few minutes and a few clicks, continuous innovation to make insurance easier and APRIL Academy: access to our catalog of free accredited training courses given by our experts.
INSURANCE_INFORMATION: Information regarding your Professional Liability Policy Certificate
UPLOAD_POLICY: Upload a copy of your Professional Liability Policy Certificate (.pdf)
UPLOAD_POLICY_CLAIM: Upload a copy of the required documents for your claim (.pdf)
CLAIM_FORM_DETAILS: For even faster claims, complete the following form. You may also call 1 (855) 745-1010.
BROKER_INDIVIDUAL_DETAILS: In order to better guide you in your submission, tell us a little more about you?
BROKER_STEP_2_DETAILS: Get a quote for your customers in minutes on our APRIL ON portal. If you’re not already a member, sign up for free.
INDIVIDUAL_STEP_2_DETAILS: Find the broker who will best meet your needs by answering a few questions.
FORM_LIST_DETAILS: Click on your preferred language to download the form.
COOKIE_ALERT: We use cookies to offer you a better browsing experience, personalise content and to analyse our traffic. You consent to our cookies if you continue to use this website. For more information please se our
SEO_DESC: A graduate of a French business school, Daphné de Vitton has worked in large international groups for the past 15 years, particularly in Europe and Asia. She joined APRIL Canada in November 2019 to hold the position of Director of Marketing Strategy, Innovation and Digital, before taking the helm of APRIL Canada in the summer of 2021.
FOOTER_RAISON: Simply to offer people support and protection when it matters.

PRIVACY_DETAILS: April adheres to very strict principles regarding privacy protection.
OUTLINE: Here is an outline or our policy.
INFORMATION_COLLECTED_1: April collects two types of information relating to Site visitors. The first type is personal data, such as your name, addresses, phone number, email address, etc., which is communicated voluntarily. Most of this information is collected when you purchase a product or service from April or when you contact us by email or by submitting a form on our Site. We may keep your name, email and/or any other personal information that you voluntarily submit to April in order to identify you for future communications and to personalize the service we provide.
INFORMATION_COLLECTED_2: The second type of information we collect is general information, such as the number of visitors on our sites, the visited pages, etc.
INFORMATION_COLLECTED_3: In general, we do not require your personal information prior to your visit on our Site. However, you may not have access to view certain site pages without disclosing your identity.
WHY_COLLECT: Why do we collect this information?
WHY_COLLECT_2: April collects personal information in order to identify visitors interested in buying its products and services. The information is also collected to enable us to personalize your access to our Site. With it, we are able to customize the content of our Site to improve your experience and ensure your satisfaction.
WHY_COLLECT_3: April has no intention of using the information you submitted to contact you without prior authorization. You can modify your preferences at any time by contacting us using the contact form available on this Site.
COOKIES_2: April may place cookies on your hard disk in order to obtain non-personal data. Cookies are files that your browser places on your hard disk when you visit a Site. Browsers may be configured to accept cookies automatically but you may also configure them to request your approval before placing a cookie.
COOKIES_3: These cookies allow us to personalize your visits and recognize you every time you return to our Site.
COOKIES_4: To have more information on Google Analytics privacy policy.
DATA_TRANSMISSION_2: April will not reveal or sell the data it has collected to third parties without your prior authorization, except where required by the law.
DATA_SECURITY_2: April will store all data it collects in a safe and secure location. In addition, we will take all precautions necessary to protect your data against loss, fraud or unwanted use.
OUTSIDE_LINK: April Site contains links to other websites. April is not responsible for the practices of said websites with regards to privacy protection.
OUTSIDE_LINK_2: April will store all data it collects in a safe and secure location. In addition, we will take all precautions necessary to protect your data against loss, fraud or unwanted use.
TRADEMARK_2: The names and logos of actual companies and products mentioned herein may be the trademarks of their respective owners.
TRADEMARK_3: The example companies, organizations, products, people and events depicted herein are fictitious. No association with any real company, organization, product, person, or event is intended or should be inferred.
TRADEMARK_4: Any rights not expressly granted herein are reserved.
CONTACT_2: For more information on the legal issues contained in these terms of use, or any questions or problems about this service, please write to us using the contact form available on this Site.
PRIVACY_2: At APRIL Canada, we highly respect and value your right to privacy and we want you to feel comfortable about any private information that you provide to us. To achieve this, and in order to comply with privacy legislation, we have developed this Privacy Policy.
PRIVACY_3: This Privacy Policy guides our conduct in the collection, use and disclosure of personal information we obtain in the course of our business of providing insurance products to you.
PRIVACY_4: For the purposes of this policy, “personal information” means information that is personally identifiable to individuals. “Non-identifiable information” means information that cannot be associated with or traced to an individual.
PRIVACY_5: APRIL Canada collects, uses and discloses Personal Information for the following purposes:
PRIVACY_BULLET_1: communicating with individuals about their insurance;
PRIVACY_BULLET_3: offering and providing insurance and related products and services;
PRIVACY_BULLET_4: verifying the identity and the accuracy of personal information with government agencies, industry associations, or other Insurers;
PRIVACY_BULLET_5: analyzing, assessing and underwriting risks on a prudent basis;
PRIVACY_BULLET_7: detecting and preventing fraud or other illegal activities;
PRIVACY_BULLET_9: complying with the laws or the requests of law enforcement agencies or regulators.
PRIVACY_BULLET_10: conducting, processing and completing transactions with customers of APRIL Canada
PRIVACY_6: We do not sell, rent or trade personal information that we collect andwe will not knowingly disclose personal information to any third parties.
PRIVACY_7: We restrict access to non-public personal information about you, which we hold, to those employees and others who need to know that information to provide products or services to you. Their right to further use the non-public personal information about you is limited by our employee code of conduct, applicable law and non-disclosure agreements where appropriate.
PRIVACY_8: We will protect your Personal Information by various physical, technological, and organizational safeguards. Safeguards will vary depending on the sensitivity, format, location and storage of the Personal Information.
PRIVACY_9: We will only collect, use, or disclose Personal Information that is necessary for the Identified Purposes, and will retain your Personal Information only as long as necessary to accomplish the identified Purposes or to satisfy our legal or business obligations.
PRIVACY_10: APRIL Canada relies on Insurance Brokers to obtain your consent to provide us with your Personal Information so that we can use it for the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy.
PRIVACY_11: If you do not consent to how your Personal Information will be used byAPRIL Canada, then please either inform your insurance broker when asking them for insurance, or advice us directly at the address below. Please note that this may limit our ability to provide you with insurance.
PRIVACY_12: APRIL Canada prides itself on its compliance with the Canadian Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL) and will seek your express consent for any communications that fall outside of the purposes of this Privacy Policy. If you have received communication from us that you feel is outside of the scope of this Policy, or if you wish to remove your consent from future communications, please also contact our Privacy Officer at the address below.
PRIVACY_13: Any complaints or inquiries regarding this policy should be directed to:
PRIVACY_15: If you are not satisfied with APRIL Canada’s response to a privacy related inquiry or complaint, you may contact the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada during business hours at

PRODUCT_CONTACT: For more information: please contact the
WHAT_BROKER_SAY: They speak of APRIL better than we do
SAMY_TEXT: We love your flexibility and especially your proactive work in all areas you undertake. We are proud to be able to use your platforms to optimize our relationships with our clients, without forgetting the professionalism of your team, which is always so welcoming and attentive to our needs. When I say team, I mean the entire APRIL team: sales, support, IT, underwriting, accounting... You guys are great! You are an outstanding MGA with whom to collaborate to ensure the peace of mind of our insureds.
ADAM_TEXT: [April] should be looked upon as an industry leader when it comes to ease of access, ease of use, and transparency. Most competitors have a portal that “works” – so long as you know how to play nice with all of its idiosyncrasies. Yes APRIL has a broad scope of offerings, and that’s fantastic, but the take away here is that I am happy to place my valued clients with a partner that has clearly put their time and energy into our relationship.
CURRENTLY_UNAVAILBE: This form is currently unavailable, please direct all your requests to :
CYBER_CLAIM_DETAILS: You have access to the 24/7/365 Cyberscout hotline to respond to incidents. Please call: 1-883-801-9268 if you believe you have had a cyber incident. Your appeal will be handled by a fraud expert who will provide you with personal assistance throughout the resolution process.
CYBER_CLAIM_DETAILS_2: There is no additional charge to call the CyberScout helpline. You will only have to pay the hotline call charges if the incident leads to further action.
CYBER_CLAIM_DETAILS_3: Calling the Cyberscout number does not constitute formal notification of a claim to your insurer. CyberScout will let you know if your incident requires notification to your insurer.
CYBER_SCOUT_PHONE: CyberScout 24/7 hotline in the event of an incident:
EXPERTS_AVAILABLE: Our experts are at your service, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5 pm.
FEATURED_CONTRACTOR: Are you a general or specialized contractor, painter, carpenter, mason or a professional working in the construction field? Are you looking for insurance?

PROVINCE_EXCLUSION_POPUP: You live outside Quebec. This point will require validation with an agent after submission of the form.
BANKRUPCY_EXCLUSION_POPUP: You are not free from bankruptcy. This point will require validation with an agent after submission of the form.
BANKRUPCY_EXCLUSION: You are not free from bankruptcy.
AUTO_VALUE_EXCLUSION_POPUP: Vehicle value exceeds $75,000. This point will require validation with an agent after submission of the form.
AUTO_VALUE_EXCLUSION: The value of the vehicle cannot exceed $75,000
AUTO_VALUE_AGE_EXCLUSION_POPUP: The value of the vehicle exceeds $25,000 and you are under 25 years old. This point will require validation with an agent after submission of the form.
AUTO_VALUE_AGE_EXCLUSION: The value of the vehicle exceeds $25,000 and you are under 25 years old.
MAJOR_INFRACTION_EXCLUSION_POPUP: You have had at least one major violation. This point will require validation with an agent after submission of the form.
MAJOR_INFRACTION_EXCLUSION: You have had at least one major violation.
CONTRACTOR_EXCLUSION_POPUP: You are carrying out activities in a sector at risk. This point will require validation with an agent after submission of the form.
CONTRACTOR_EXCLUSION: You are carrying out activities in a sector at risk.
